dc_title_s: The Times map of British South Africa, the Transvaal and Orange Free State
dc_description_s: Cartographic Details: Scale 1:2,500,000. 40 miles = 1 in. Map of South Africa showing British South Africa, South African Republic, Orange Free State, Portuguese and German territory, roads, railways, goldfields, telegraph lines, steamship routes and distances during the Boer War (1899-1902). Prime meridian: Greenwich. Cover title: The Times war map of South Africa.|Insets Witwatersrand Scale [ca. 1:200,000] -- Mafeking district -- Southwestern frontier Scale [ca. 1:200,000] -- Map of Natal from Pietermaritzburg to Newcastle Scale [ca. 1:500,000] -- Wales on the same scale as the general map. ; Fourth edition.|98 x 72 centimeters|Scale 1:2,500,000; 40 miles = 1 inch|Ames Library of South Asia Maps
